paper_abstract: The DO experiment has used the European DataGrid (EDG) testbed to reprocess real data obtained from the Tevatron collider at the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory. Pushing the use of the EDG software beyond feasibility studies has produced a set of recommendations for authors of experiment-level software, for producers of middleware and for designers of Grid systems. This paper describes the DO experience with the EDG software and the resulting recommendations. Copyright (c) 2005 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Crunching real data on the Grid: practice and experience with the European DataGrid
